attributes.action: Hold a referendum in England on a English only Parliament to solve the Midlothian Question.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
It is absurd and against the human rights of the English voters that Scottish, Welsh and Northern Irish MP's are allowed to vote on English legislation, but English MP's can't do the same on matters concerning those countries. 

England has already rejected efforts to break it up into regions such as the North East, and clearly wants certain powers devolved back to a sovereign English Parliament, similar to those now held by the Scottish parliament. 

In order to resolve the Midlothian question, we request that the English are offered a referendum on an English only Parliament.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
